alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 9:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Owsley, northwestern Leslie, northern Perry, northwestern Knott, west central Floyd, southern Breathitt, southeastern Magoffin and northeastern Clay Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 929 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Curt to Buckhorn to Panco. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Flintville, Chavies, Lost Creek, Barwick, Haddix, Clayhole, Wolf Coal, Watts, Hardshell and Howard Creek around 935 PM EDT. Lamont around 940 PM EDT. Krypton, Dice and Ned around 945 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Daisydell, Ary, Rowdy, Decoy, Noble, Evanston, Buck, Vail, Hindman, Waldo, Talcum, Fisty, Elmrock, Emmalena, Orchard, Vest, Bearville and Gunlock. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 19. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry
